docs.lead_paragraph: In households across the country, children conceived with donated sperm are struggling with serious genetic conditions inherited from men they have never met.

headline.seo: In Sperm Banks, a Roll of the Genetic Dice
headline.main: In Choosing a Sperm Donor, a Roll of the Genetic Dice
headline.print_headline: In Choosing a Sperm Donor, A Roll of the Genetic Dice

docs.abstract: Some children conceived with donated sperm are struggling with serious genetic conditions inherited from men they have never met; while sperm donors are no more likely to carry genetic diseases than others, they can father a far greater number of children; phenomenon carries the added risk of making such genes more pervasive in the general population.
docs.snippet: In households across the country, children conceived with donated sperm are struggling with serious genetic conditions inherited from men they have never met.
